title: Ageing Common Health Problems
content:
Read more about [healthy eating.](https://healthify.nz/hauora-wellbeing/h/healthy-eating-basics "Healthy eating basics")
####  Bladder and urinary tract 
Your bladder may not stretch as much as you get older, meaning you need to urinate (wee) more often. Weakening of your bladder muscles makes it harder to completely empty your bladder and you may lose some bladder control (urinary incontinence). For men, this can be made worse by having an enlarged prostate. 
It will help if you:
  * empty your bladder regularly
  * stay at a healthy weight and lose weight if you need to
  * don’t smoke
  * do pelvic floor exercises
  * avoid things that can irritate your bladder, eg, [caffeine](https://healthify.nz/hauora-wellbeing/c/caffeine "Caffeine"), acidic foods, alcohol and fizzy drinks can make incontinence worse
  * avoid getting constipated (bowel blocked up).


Read more about pelvic floor exercises for [men](https://healthify.nz/health-a-z/p/pelvic-floor-training-men "Pelvic floor training – men") and [women.](https://healthify.nz/health-a-z/p/pelvic-floor-training-women "Pelvic floor training – women")
####  Memory and ability to think (cognitive abilities) 
As your brain gets older you may find your memory isn’t as good as it was (eg, you forget names or words) or you can’t think as clearly.
It will help if you:
  * stay physically active every day
  * stay mentally active 
  * stay socially active to improve your mental wellbeing
  * eat a healthy diet and limit alcohol as it can add to confusion
  * don’t smoke
  * treat cardiovascular risk factors (eg, [high blood pressure](https://healthify.nz/health-a-z/b/blood-pressure-high "Hypertension"), [high ](https://healthify.nz/health-a-z/c/cholesterol-high "Cholesterol - high")[cholesterol](https://healthify.nz/health-a-z/c/cholesterol-high "Cholesterol - high") and [diabetes](https://healthify.nz/health-a-z/d/diabetes-type-2/ "Diabetes – type 2")) as they may increase loss of cognitive abilities.


Read more about [staying mentally active(external link)](https://betterhealth.vic.gov.au/healthyliving/keeping-active "Open external link").
####  Eyes and ears 
Your vision and hearing can deteriorate as you age. Read more about vision problems ([cataracts](https://healthify.nz/health-a-z/c/cataract "Cataract"), [macular ](https://healthify.nz/health-a-z/m/macular-degeneration "Macular degeneration")[degeneration](https://healthify.nz/health-a-z/m/macular-degeneration "Macular degeneration") and [glaucoma](https://healthify.nz/health-a-z/g/glaucoma "Glaucoma")) and [hearing loss.](https://healthify.nz/health-a-z/h/hearing-loss-in-adults "Hearing loss in adults")
It will help if you:
  * have regular check-ups
  * wear [sunglasses](https://healthify.nz/hauora-wellbeing/s/sunglasses-why-it-s-important-to-wear "Sunglasses – why it’s important to wear") and a wide-brimmed hat to protect your eyes when you’re outside
  * wear ear plugs when you are around loud noises.


####  Teeth 
Your gums might recede (pull back from your teeth) as you get older, and some medicines can give you a dry mouth. This makes tooth decay more likely.
